intro: Schefflera apioidea, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately compound leaves that resemble arrowheads, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 meters, with a dense, bushy form. Its leaves are glossy and dark green, and it produces small, inconspicuous white flowers followed by red berries. Schefflera apioidea is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its adaptability and attractive foliage.
